repnme.cdata!:
Colombia - First Phase of the Productive
            Partnerships Support Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the First Phase of the
            Productive Partnerships Support Project for Colombia were as
            follows: outcome was moderately satisfactory, risk to
            development outcome was significant, Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory, and Borrower performance was
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: sufficient
            attention needs to be paid to the needs of both farmers and
            buyers. Revolving credit mechanisms in rural areas should be
            designed in line with the capacity of the user. Producer
            alliances require a differentiation in design that takes
            into account trust, relationships, and maturity to determine
            the level of value added that a productive partnership
            project is likely to generate. Productive partnership
            projects are more likely to succeed when they are part of an
            integrated rural development approach.

Colombia - First Phase of the Productive

25472369.trustfund:
BBFAO-BB FAO,TF025829-PHRD-PRODUCTIVE PARTNERSHIPS
            FOR PEACE,TF029532-PHRD-LAND REFORM PROJECT,TF026672-PHRD-COLOMBIA: PRODUCTIVE
            PARTNERSHIP FOR PEACE PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Productive Partnerships
            Support Project for Colombia were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            Bank performance was satisfactory, and Borrower performance
            was also satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: such
            development objectives as increase income and employment
            should be kept as the 'contribution of the project to
            higher level development objectives of the country.'
            Hence, the objectives of the second project are to increase
            competitiveness, entrepreneurship and sustainability of
            partnerships, and producer associations. Such outcomes can
            be credited directly to the project. As a remedy, the
            follow-up project introduced time saving measures such as a
            framework insurance policy covering all future partnerships.
            It delegates more responsibility to the regional level and
            to the partners for the pre-investment studies and
            partnership structuring, shortening the preparation cycle.
            The results, up to the time of this ICR preparation are
            encouraging. Although identifying skilled people to prepare
            partnership feasibility studies remains a challenge. Poor
            feasibility studies usually result in delays and other
            problems (often requiring restructuring) during
            implementation. The gradual reduction in the complexity of
            the studies while focusing on the essentials and
            particularly on risks diminished implementation delays and
            eliminated non-viable partnerships from the onset. Perennial
            crops that require some medium-term investment are not very
            suitable for poor farmers, as they do not have the financial
            capacity to maintain those crops over the years before
            seeing the financial results.

5084151.trustfund:
TF025829-PHRD-PRODUCTIVE PARTNERSHIPS
            FOR PEACE,TF029532-PHRD-LAND REFORM PROJECT
5084151.majtheme: Social protection and risk management,Environment and natural resource management,Rural development,Social dev/gender/inclusion

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Productive
            Partnerships Support Project for Colombia is to generate
            income, create employment, and promote social cohesion of
            poor rural communities in an economic and environmentally
            sustainable manner through the development and
            implementation of a demand-driven, productive partnership
            scheme with the private sector. There are two main project
            components. The first component finances technical
            assistance and training for activities associated with
            information sharing, mobilization and screening of interest,
            pre-investments, ex-ante evaluation of detailed productive
            partnership sub-project proposals, and studies. The second
            component supports the implementation of productive
            partnerships by financing 1) cost sharing transfers as a
            financial incentive for participating small farmers producer
            organizations; and 2) technical assistance and training to
            productive partnership participants. The third component,
            project management, includes the operation of a management
            information system, and the design and implementation of
            monitoring, evaluation, and learning arrangements.
